channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Struggling auto giant Stellantis says CEO Carlos Tavares will retire in 2026 when his contract ends
item.description: The U.S.-French-Italian company whose brands include Chrysler, Citroen, Fiat and Jeep is going through a rough patch, in particular with sales in Nort...

item.title: ‘No One’s Life Is More Important to Him Than His’: Chris Christie on Trump and the Politicization of Storm Relief
Richard Branson avoids gossip at all costs. Here’s why that might backfire on him.
item.description: "Everything comes back to people,” the billionaire business magnate said regarding his success.

item.title: A Small-C Conservative Case for Kamala Harris
item.description: The Democratic candidate would bring three things the country desperately needs: stability, unity and optimism.

item.title: What Flying in a Wind Tunnel Reveals About Birds
item.description: Some birds migrate thousands of miles every autumn. How exactly do they manage it? Scientists built a flight chamber to find out.

item.title: How The Times Investigated Indian Political Ties to Labor Abuse in the Sugar Industry
item.description: Western companies such as Coca-Cola buy sugar from fields where workers suffer abuses. But the country has labor laws. Where was the government?

item.title: Conflict Between Israel and Iran Adds to Oil Market Volatility
item.description: Israel and Iran are fighting at a time when prices are under pressure because of weak demand in China and concerns about oversupply.

item.title: Why Lawmakers Ignore Human Rights Abuses in India’s Sugar Fields
item.description: Politicians run most of the mills in the state of Maharashtra. They deny or downplay evidence of coerced hysterectomies, debt bondage and child labor ...

item.title: In Lebanon’s Bekaa Valley, a Lone Gas Station Is a Lifeline
item.description: Thousands have fled the town of Baalbek amid a barrage of Israeli airstrikes. For those who remain, Ali Jawad’s business is a critical piece of an inf...

item.title: Elon Musk Is Going All In to Elect Donald Trump
item.description: Elon Musk is planting himself in Pennsylvania, has brought his brain trust to help and may even knock on doors himself.

item.title: Obama slams ‘crazy’ Trump in his first campaign rally for Harris
item.description: Obama trained his fire on Trump during a pumped-up rally in Pittsburgh, comparing the Republican's long speeches to late Cuban communist leader Fidel ...

item.title: In Lebanon’s Bekaa Valley, a Lone Gas Station Is a Lifeline
item.description: Thousands have fled the town of Baalbek amid a barrage of Israeli airstrikes. For those who remain, Ali Jawad’s business is a critical piece of an inf...

item.title: Italian carmaker Stellantis overhauls C-Suite as CEO set to retire in 2026
item.description: CEO Carlos Tavares faced pressure as the carmaker fights low sales in the U.S. and a bloated inventory.

item.title: Rafael Nadal ends tennis career as second highest earner in ATP
item.description: Nadal will leave the sport as its second-highest earner of career prize money with more than $130 million.

item.title: In Wisconsin, Democrats Hope Competing Down Ballot Helps Harris, Too
item.description: For the first time in 13 years, Wisconsin Democrats are contesting a number of local races. Even a few thousand voters energized by the candidates at ...
